issue.title: Embed SDF XML files into library

content.raw:
I think the [soap envelope](https://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope/) is a good example. It allows custom elements inside it's body using the [<any>](https://www.w3schools.com/xml/el_any.asp) tag.

If the sdformat schema added a tag (mabye call it `<third_party>`?) that allowed any xml element inside, it could validate the SDF regardless of the content of the <third_party> tags.

If third party elements specify a [namespace](https://www.w3schools.com/xml/xml_namespaces.asp), and the schema for that namespace is available (usually the namespace is a URI where the schema can be downloaded, but I recommend adding an API to give custom schemas to sdformat), they can be validated by sdformat too.
